assertion: Reproductive health discussions are incomplete without mentioning infertility.
reason: A large number of couples worldwide including India are infertile despite unprotected sexual co-habitation.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Infertility can be caused by physical, congenital, diseases, drugs, immunological, or psychological reasons.
reason: In India, often the female is blamed for the couple being childless, but more often the problem lies in the male partner.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Specialised health care units like infertility clinics can help in diagnosis and corrective treatment of some infertility disorders.
reason: Couples can be assisted to have children through certain techniques known as assisted reproductive technologies (ART).
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: In vitro fertilisation (IVF) followed by embryo transfer (ET) is a method of assisted reproductive technology.
reason: In this method, ova from the wife/donor and sperms from the husband/donor are collected and induced to form zygote under simulated laboratory conditions.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Zygotes or early embryos with up to 8 blastomeres can be transferred into the fallopian tube (ZIFT).
reason: Embryos with more than 8 blastomeres are transferred into the uterus (IUT) to complete further development.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Gamete intra fallopian transfer (GIFT) involves transfer of an ovum from a donor into the fallopian tube of another female.
reason: This female cannot produce ovum but can provide a suitable environment for fertilisation and further development.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Intra cytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) is a specialised procedure where a sperm is directly injected into the ovum.
reason: This forms an embryo in the laboratory for couples with infertility issues.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Artificial insemination (AI) technique is used for infertility cases due to inability of the male to inseminate or very low sperm counts.
reason: Semen collected from the husband or healthy donor is introduced artificially into the vagina or uterus (IUI) of the female.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: All ART techniques require extremely high precision handling and expensive instrumentation.
reason: These facilities are presently available only in very few centres in the country and benefits are affordable to a limited number of people.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.

assertion: Emotional, religious and social factors deter adoption of ART methods.
reason: Legal adoption is one of the best methods for couples looking for parenthood in India.
options: A. Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is the correct explanation of Assertion.
B. Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation of Assertion.
C. Assertion is true but Reason is false.
D. Assertion is false but Reason is true.
